title: MPhil/PhD Scholarship - A mixed-method study comparing and contrasting dental professionals’ and informal carers’ experiences of managing dental pain and discomfort in older people living with dementia in community settings
text:
★ View Employer Profile 
Avery Hill Campus 
A University of Greenwich Vice Chancellor’s Scholarship 2015/16 is available to undertake doctoral research into experiences of managing dental pain and discomfort in older people living with dementia in community settings. Research will involve a combination of methods starting with a systematic review of the literature, as well as exploring barriers and enablers to managing dental pain through qualitative interviews with informal carers and dental professionals, living and working, in community settings. The work will build upon current research within the Faculty of Education and Health on managing pain in people living with dementia. The successful candidate will receive a stipend of £14,057 in the first year which will increase in-line with the national minimum doctoral stipend for the duration of the scholarship. 
For further information please contact the supervisor: Liz West; E.West@gre.ac.uk 
Bursary available (subject to satisfactory performance): 
Year 1: £14,057 Year 2: In line with RCUK rate Year 3: In line with RCUK rate 
In addition, the successful candidate will receive a contribution to tuition fees equivalent to the university’s Home/EU rate (£4,052) for the duration of their scholarship. International applicants will need to pay the remainder tuition fee of £7,648 for the 2015/16 session and is subject to an annual increase. Scholarships are available for three years from the date scholars first register as an MPhil/PhD student with the university. Scholarships are available for full-time study only. Applicants must hold a Master’s degree (UK or UK equivalent) or a First Class or Upper Second Class Honours Bachelor’s in a relevant discipline. 
For additional information about the scholarship and links to the application form please go to: http://www2.gre.ac.uk/research/study/studentships 
Please read this information before making an application. Applications need to be made online via http://www2.gre.ac.uk/research/study/apply/application_process No other form of application will be considered. 
All applications must include the following information. Applications not containing these documents will not be considered. Scholarship Reference Number (Ref VCS-EH-01-15) – included in the personal statement section together with your personal statement as to why you are applying a research proposal * a CV including 2 referees * academic qualification certificates/transcripts and IELTs/English Language certificate if you are an international applicant * 
*upload to the supporting information section of the application form. Attachments need to be in PDF format. 
The closing date for applications is midnight (UTC) on 25 September 2015 
The scholarship must commence before 1 December 2015. Earlier start dates may be set depending on availability. Share this PhD
